justification: The dominance scale consisted of four items such as 'The person enjoys having control over me.' Participants rated these items on a seven-point scale, evaluating their overall impression of their partner after inducing dominance or prestige expressions.

The prestige scale also included four items, like 'I recognize his/her unique talents and abilities.' Participants rated these items on the same seven-point scale to measure their overall impression of their partner, successfully differentiating prestige from dominance conditions.

measured_by: Hubristic and Authentic Pride Scales (Tracy & Robins, 2007)
justification: The hubristic pride scale contained items such as 'arrogant, conceited, egotistical,' etc. Participants rated their impressions of the partner’s feelings using a seven-point scale, contributing to the manipulation check for hubristic pride's effectiveness.

measured_by: Hubristic and Authentic Pride Scales (Tracy & Robins, 2007)
justification: The authentic pride scale included items like 'accomplished, achieving, confident,' etc. Participants evaluated these on a seven-point scale, demonstrating the successful induction of authentic pride in the intended conditions.

measured_by: Non-verbal displays validated by Witkower et al. (2020)
justification: Participants were exposed to non-verbal expressions of dominance and prestige, which were previously validated. This method manipulated the initial perceptions of the partner’s social rank, further validated through participant ratings.

measured_by: Fear of Negative Evaluation Scale (Rodebaugh et al., 2004; Weeks et al., 2005)
justification: The scale consisted of eight items measuring concerns about others' disapproval, indicating the participants' baseline levels of this trait for contextual understanding in negotiation settings.

measured_by: Brief measure of the Big Five Personality traits (Gosling et al., 2003)
justification: Participants completed a 10-item measure to assess their openness, conscientiousness, extraversion, agreeableness, and emotional stability, offering insight into their personality traits as relevant background information.
